message: I have an online web service, and I want an analytics service works on the server. What do you recommend?

data.message: you want something to be installed on the server? why you don't try http://mixpanel.com this a paid service and it gives you real time analytics plus they have awesome features for variables check their people method.
If you are willing to pay, New Relic might be the best option. It's mainly for performance analytics, but it has nice realtime analytics features, and they support .NET webservices.
Otherwise, you are probably going to depend on IIS7+ require monitoring or Advanced Logging Module, or bake something on your own of course.
One more possible option is use Google analytics APIs to create events. It's not hard BTW.
Another option, many .NET hosts will provide you with SmarterTools license. SmarterStats might do a good job for this (I assume).

Google Analytics can be called by server-side scripts, and they put a sample on their website. I will rewrite it & post it as a python library on github (hopefully :) )

The rest of the options are great, but they are a lot more than I need right now, and my app is not in .net ;)
So, you go for the option "use Google analytics APIs to create events". As I mentioned, it shouldn't be hard. Good luck.

Here is the link https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/other/mobileWebsites

Thanks to everyone for their support :)
Google analytics has limited numbers of Events and they are not Real Time. that's why i recommend you MixPanel :)
MixPanel has more, but GA is good enough for my purposes. The site is not under heavy load (till now ;) )
